thread.title: Becky Morgan pleased with opening round in India
thread.title_full: Becky Morgan pleased with opening round in India

title: Becky Morgan pleased with opening round in India
text:
Becky Morgan pleased with opening round in India 23 Oct 2015 14:01:57 
comments 
England's Liz Young and Wales' Becky Morgan are three shots off the lead after a demanding first day of the Hero Women's Indian Open in Delhi on Thursday. 
Only three of the 114-strong field at DLF Golf and Country Club broke par, with Denmark's Emily Pedersen leading on two under, one shot ahead of Thailand's Saraporn Chamchoi and Italy's Giulia Sergas. 
Finland's Minea Blomqvist and Germany's Sophia Popov carded level par rounds of 72, with Young and Morgan part of a seven-strong group on one over. 
"It's very tough," Morgan said of the course after two birdies and three bogeys. 
"It's very up and down and it's quite tight off the tee. The greens are very undulating and firm so it's hard to get it close to the hole. 
"I thought at the beginning of the week even par would be a pretty good score just because it's so tough to get it close, so I am really happy with one over par today." Related Sport News
